intro: Ebenus sibthorpii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in Kazakhstan and surrounding areas. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, and its succulent, narrow leaves adapted to conserve water. Ebenus sibthorpii thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. It is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
